        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2051716833" title="alesa...@alesandroortiz.com"><!---->alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<!----></a>
      alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Fri, Aug 20, 2021, 1:06 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Aug 20, 2021, 1:06 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Aug 20, 2021, 1:06 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key

          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Aug 20, 2021, 1:06 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This does not sound like a security bug. It seems more like a functional bug in the autofill system. Derestricting the view.<span class="line"><!---->This does not sound like a security bug. It seems more like a functional bug in the autofill system. Derestricting the view.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 4<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1241718#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by

        Able to reproduce the issue on chrome version #93.0.4577.58(without fix) using Windows 10 as per steps in c#0.<span class="line"><!---->Able to reproduce the issue on chrome version #93.0.4577.58(without fix) using Windows 10 as per steps in c#0.<!----></span><br>Tested the issue on latest canary #99.0.4739.0 using Windows 10.<span class="line"><!---->Tested the issue on latest canary #99.0.4739.0 using Windows 10.<!----></span><br>Observations:<span class="line"><!---->Observations:<!----></span><br>1.Added address in chrome://settings/addresses 2.Opened a new tab<span class="line"><!---->1.Added address in chrome://settings/addresses 2.Opened a new tab<!----></span>(<span class="line"><!---->(<!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>3. Navigated to given webpage in c#0 <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigated to given webpage in c#0 <!----></span><br>4. Pressed up arrow and autofill not showing up<span class="line"><!---->4. Pressed up arrow and autofill not showing up<!----></span><br><br>@alesandro: Could you please review the attached screencast and let us know if we missed anything from our end. Help us in verifying the fix on latest canary M-99.<span class="line"><!---->@alesandro: Could you please review the attached screencast and let us know if we missed anything from our end. Help us in verifying the fix on latest canary M-99.<!----></span><br><br>Attaching Screencast for reference:<span class="line"><!---->Attaching Screencast for reference:<!----></span><br>Without fix: <span class="line"><!---->Without fix: <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/file/d/17zdrVW78mUL8GR8Isfd_yZdm_sDPEjo3/view<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17zdrVW78mUL8GR8Isfd_yZdm_sDPEjo3/view"><!---->https://drive.google.com/file/d/17zdrVW78mUL8GR8Isfd_yZdm_sDPEjo3/view<!----></a><br>With fix: <span class="line"><!---->With fix: <!----></span>https://watch.screencastify.com/v/LNIirLyj4u8jJ4BV2IKR<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://watch.screencastify.com/v/LNIirLyj4u8jJ4BV2IKR"><!---->https://watch.screencastify.com/v/LNIirLyj4u8jJ4BV2IKR<!----></a><br><br>Thanks!!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks!!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)

      <div class="select-container">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This does not sound like a security bug. It seems more like a functional bug in the autofill system. Derestricting the view.<span class="line"><!---->This does not sound like a security bug. It seems more like a functional bug in the autofill system. Derestricting the view.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1241718#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key

            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Navigated to given webpage in c#0 <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigated to given webpage in c#0 <!----></span><br>4. Pressed up arrow and autofill not showing up<span class="line"><!---->4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
