      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key

        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        }

          margin-top: 1em;

      </style>

            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1241718: Security: User can accidentally provide autofill data to page when using browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)

        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Navigated to given webpage in c#0 <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigated to given webpage in c#0 <!----></span><br>4. Pressed up arrow and autofill not showing up<span class="line"><!---->4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

    <mr-flipper></mr-flipper>

      warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>
    <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)

      <div class="select-container">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {

    <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>

      <div class="select-container">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <br>

          M-95 Target-95 FoundIn-95 FoundIn-94 FoundIn-93 FoundIn-92 Triaged-ET OS-Linux OS-Mac Pri-2
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Untriaged
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          satishy@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          M-95 Target-95 FoundIn-95 FoundIn-94 FoundIn-93 FoundIn-92 Triaged-ET OS-Linux OS-Mac Pri-2
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Able to reproduce the issue on reported chrome version #95.0.4612.2 using Windows 10 as per steps in <span class="line"><!---->Able to reproduce the issue on reported chrome version #95.0.4612.2 using Windows 10 as per steps in <!----></span>comment#0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c0"><!---->comment#0<!----></a><br><br>Reproducible:<span class="line"><!---->Reproducible:<!----></span><br>----------------------<span class="line"><!---->----------------------<!----></span><br><br>Canary - 95.0.4621.0<span class="line"><!---->Canary - 95.0.4621.0<!----></span><br>Dev - 94.0.4606.20<span class="line"><!---->Dev - 94.0.4606.20<!----></span><br>Beta - 93.0.4577.58<span class="line"><!---->Beta - 93.0.4577.58<!----></span><br>Stable - 92.0.4515.159<span class="line"><!---->Stable - 92.0.4515.159<!----></span><br><br>The issue is seen from M-81, this is non regression issue.         The PoC stopped working due to fixes related to other issues I reported; this is preventing the autofill prompt from appearing at all in the PoC.<span class="line"><!---->The PoC stopped working due to fixes related to other issues I reported; this is preventing the autofill prompt from appearing at all in the PoC.<!----></span><br><br>I'll post the fixed PoCs once they're ready, either later tonight or sometime tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I'll post the fixed PoCs once they're ready, either later tonight or sometime tomorrow.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 20, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<span class="line"><!---->A user can accidentally provide autofill data to a page if they use browser keyboard shortcuts with tab key, such as ctrl + tab or ctrl + shift + tab to switch tabs.<!----></span><br><br>It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<span class="line"><!---->It's difficult to convince a user to intentionally do this, since the autofill prompt must be visible prior to using the keyboard shortcut, but using browser keyboard shortcuts shouldn't provide page autofill data even in unlikely conditions. I discovered this accidentally while testing autofill and leaving the autofill item highlighted (either by mouse over the item or by keyboard navigation of the autofill prompt) before switching tabs using keyboard shortcuts.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<span class="line"><!---->I've tested this with addresses (which includes name + email) and credit cards. For sample input, see the video recording.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 95.0.4612.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one address in chrome://settings/addresses<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab (optionally navigate it to anywhere).<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html<!----></a><br>3. Press up or down arrow once.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow once.<!----></span><br>4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut (ctrl + tab / ctrl + shift + tab)<!----></span><br><br>PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for credit card, using up/down arrow:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one credit card in chrome://settings/payments<!----></span><br>1. Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->1. Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ctrl-tab.html?creditcard<!----></a><br>Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<span class="line"><!---->Steps 3-4: Same as prior PoC.<!----></span><br><br>PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<span class="line"><!---->PoC for address, using space + mouse over:<!----></span><br>1. Open a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a new tab.<!----></span><br>2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->2. Open a second tab and navigate it to either of the prior PoCs.<!----></span><br>3. Press space key.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press space key.<!----></span><br>4. Move mouse over selection item.<span class="line"><!---->4. Move mouse over selection item.<!----></span><br>5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch tabs using keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofilled data is provided to page, because user pressed tab key while using a browser keyboard shortcut.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofilled data is *not* provided to page, because using browser shortcuts should not result in autofill item selection.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1241718#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </dialog>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
